title: Textile, 1700–50
medium:
Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk-core threads 
Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Madame Raimundo de Madrazo
description: Length of woven silk, brocaded with an undulating pink ribbon forming an overall S-curve, interspersed with baskets of flowers, in red, rose, yellow-green, dark green, and blue, on a white ground woven with a monochrome honeycomb pattern.

exhibitions.title: The Huguenot Legacy: English Silver, 1680-1760 from the Alan & Simone Hartman Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1700–50.
1700–50. Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk-core threads 
Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading). Museum purchase through gift of Madame Raimundo de Madrazo. 1955-162-2-a,b.
